definition: to offer birthday congratulations (to an elderly person)
surname Zhu
to wish/to express good wishes/to pray/(old) wizard
long life/old age/age/life/birthday/funerary
surname Shou

sentences.english: Today is grandma's 80th birthday, and all the family have got together to congratulate her.
sentences.chinese: 今天是奶奶的80壽誕，全家人聚在一起給奶奶祝壽。

sentences.english: On his birthday, his students wanted to give him a party.
sentences.chinese: 一次逢王的生日，他的門生想給他祝壽。

sentences.english: The army marches before the Queen on her birthday.
sentences.chinese: 軍隊在女王面前進行步操儀式，爲女王祝壽。

sentences.english: Finally, all civil and military officials in the court held high wine glasses to congratulate on Emperor Xuanzong birthday.
sentences.chinese: 最後朝中文武百官高舉酒杯齊聲爲玄宗祝壽。

sentences.english: Even for his mother's birthday , he only bought a kilogram of meat .
sentences.chinese: 給母親祝壽，也僅買了兩斤肉。

sentences.english: Both sides were full of rows of tombs, which seemed like a bun used to celebrate birthday in a better-off family.
sentences.chinese: 兩面都已埋到層層疊疊，宛然闊人家裏祝壽時的饅頭。

sentences.english: Lin said the puppet show is to greet the gods in thank God activities and birthday party oriented.
sentences.chinese: 林老師表示布袋戲在近代演出以迎神謝神和祝壽爲主。

sentences.english: As all the daughters' thoughts, I am the happiest daughter in the world for I have the best father.
sentences.chinese: 今天是爸爸生日，我請了假回家爲他老人家祝壽。

sentences.english: She is really the most beautiful creature that was seen at court upon the birthday.
sentences.chinese: 在祝壽宴會上她是宮庭裏見到的最美麗的人。

sentences.english: Two daytime inside complete a large blessing Lu life to wish life diagram, this how may?
sentences.chinese: 兩天之內完成一幅大型的福祿壽祝壽圖，這怎麼可能？

definition: Wu Cheng'en (1500-1582), author (or compiler) of novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记
god of longevity/elderly person whose birthday is being celebrated
to praise/well done, bravo!
(myth.) peaches of immortality, kept by Xi Wangmu/fresh or confectionery peaches offered as a birthday gift
birthday (of an old person)
to offer flowers/to lay flowers (as a memorial)
abundant harvest of all food crops/bumper grain harvest
General Yuchi Gong (585-658), famous military man instrumental in founding the Tang dynasty
may you enjoy boundless longevity (idiom)/long may you live
congratulatory gift
to pass on the light of Buddha
feast/celebration
to accept a life of ease/to enjoy a comfortable retirement
ceremony
to bless/to praise
taboo name (e.g. of emperor)
